title: Goblet, "America", 1750–70
dimensions:
Cup and cover H: 28.9 cm (11 3/8 in.)
Cup H x diam.: 21.1 x 9.2 cm (8 5/16 x 3 5/8 in.)
Cover H x diam.: 8.8 x 10.2 cm (3 7/16 in. x 4 in.)
Base diam.: 10.7 cm (4 3/16 in.)
creditline: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde
description: a)  Flaring chalice cut at the bottom and engraved with the figures of the Four Continents between rocaille columns.  Asia with crescent sceptre and camels; Europe with globe and sceptre; Africa in feather skirt and headdress, with monkey and elephant; America in feather skirt, collar and headdress, with lion, crocodile and camel.  Cut, short baluster stem and foot. b) Cover, engraved with scrolls, and a cut knob, gilt, like rim of cup.

tombstone.epitaph:
Goblet, "America", 1750–70.
1750–70. Glass, cut, engraved, with gilding. Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde. 1960-1-81-a,b.
